info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND EAST CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 130 PM MDT... At 1259 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Glorieta, or 12 miles east of Santa Fe, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pecos and Glorieta. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 294 and 306. State Road 63 between Mile Markers 2 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
